objects.name: Info
objects.string:
Bem Vindo ao Pixel Space !!!

Sobreviva aos ataques inimigos 
vindo de outras galáxias e
Prove ser um Capitão Digno dessa galáxia.

Pegue os PowerUP's

Azul = Super Nova
Vermelho = Estrela Cadente
Amarelo = Escudo
Raio Amarelo = Extinção estelar

Controle sua Nave e prove ser o 
Melhor Pixel dessa Galáxia !

O universo está ao seu lado...

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovement

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Health (life points and damages for objects)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Add some damage to the object, decreasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit

parameters.description: Value of the damage to do (will be removed from object health)
parameters.name: DamageValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is considered dead (no more health).
eventsFunctions.name: IsDead

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDamaged

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object, incrasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Heal

parameters.description: How much to heal (will be added to object health)
parameters.name: HealValue

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object health to set it to a specific value (check if the actions to damage or heal the object are not better suited to your use case before using this one).
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealth

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage cooldown (in seconds) (0 for no cooldown)
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageCooldown

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make the specified object(s) blink for the given duration.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the blinking, in seconds
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified objects are flashing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the flashing of the specified object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.


Example uses:
- Floating objects, such as powerups or coins
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns

Properties:
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.

Example uses:
- Floating pickups
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Horizontal distance

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SineMovement

events.comment: Set the center of movement to the initial location of the object
Increment counters that are used to calculate movement

eventsFunctions.description: Counter used to change the Y position of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: SineProgressY

eventsFunctions.description: Counter used to change the X position of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: SineProgressX
SetCenterY
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set center Y position of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.name: SetCenterX
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set center X position of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Reset sine progress counters. The object will return to the initial state.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetSineCounters

propertyDescriptors.label: Horizontal speed, in degrees per second
propertyDescriptors.name: HorizontalSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Vertical speed, in degrees per second
propertyDescriptors.name: VerticalSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Horizontal distance: amplitude of the movement on X axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: HorizontalDistance

propertyDescriptors.label: Vertical distance: amplitude of the movement on Y axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: VerticalDistance

propertyDescriptors.label: Counter used to change X position
propertyDescriptors.name: SineProgressX

propertyDescriptors.label: Counter used to change Y position
propertyDescriptors.name: SineProgressY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: StayOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: StayOnScreen

parameters: min(max(Object.X(), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 + Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginLeft()), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Width() - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginRight())

min(max(Object.Y(), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2+ Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginTop()), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Height() - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginBottom())

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
